info.description:
OpenStorage is a clustered implementation of the Open Storage specification and relies on the OCI runtime.
It allows you to run stateful services in containers in a multi-host clustered environment.
This document represents the API documentaton of Openstorage, for the GO client please visit:
https://github.com/libopenstorage/openstorage
info.title: OSD API.

get.description: This will return a list of alerts for the requested resource

parameters.description:
Resourcetype to get alerts with.
0: All
1: Volume
2: Node
3: Cluster
4: Drive

resourcetype to get alerts with.

get.description: This will return the value/data for given secret key

Comma separated name value pairs

Comma separated name value pairs

Alert.description: Alert is a structure that represents an alert object

unique_tag.description: UniqueTag helps identify a unique alert for a given resouce

Alerts.description: Alerts is an array of Alert objects

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential for cloud

ID.description: ID is Backup ID in the cloud

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is cloud credential to be used for backup

ClusterID.description: ClusterID is the optional clusterID for the request

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential for cloud to be used for the request

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is optional Source VolumeID for the request

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential for cloud to be used for the request

Force.description: Force Delete cloudbackup even if there are dependencies

ID.description: ID is the ID of the cloud backup

All.description: All if set to true, backups for all clusters in the cloud are processed

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential for cloud to be used for the request

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is optional Source VolumeID for the request

Backups.description: Backups is list of backups in cloud for given volume/cluster/s

All.description: All if set to true, backups for all clusters in the cloud are processed

ClusterID.description: ClusterID is the optional clusterID for the request

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential for cloud to be used for the request

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is optional Source VolumeID for the request
SrcVolumeID is volume ID which was backedup

Status.description: Status indicates whether backup was completed/failed

Timestamp.description: TimeStamp is the time at which either backup completed/failed

SrcVolumeID.description:
SrcVolumeID is volumeID for which history of backup/restore
is being requested

HistoryList.description: HistoryList is list of past backup/restores in the cluster

ID.description: ID is the ID of the cloud backup

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is Source volumeID of the backup

SrcVolumeName.description: SrcvolumeName is name of the sourceVolume of the backup

Status.description: Status indicates the status of the backup

Timestamp.description:
Timestamp is the timestamp at which the source volume
was backed up to cloud

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the credential to be used for restore operation

ID.description: ID is the backup ID being restored

NodeID.description:
NodeID is the optional NodeID for provisioning restore
volume (ResoreVolumeName should not be specified)

RestoreVolumeName.description:
RestoreVolumeName is optional volume Name of the new volume to be created
in the cluster for restoring the cloudbackup

RestoreVolumeID.description: RestoreVolumeID is the volumeID to which the backup is being restored

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the cloud credential used with this schedule

MaxBackups.description:
MaxBackups are the maximum number of backups retained
in cloud.Older backups are deleted

Schedule.description: Schedule is the frequence of backup

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is the schedule's source volume

UUID.description: UUID is the UUID of the newly created schedule
UUID is UUID of the schedule to be deleted

Schedules.description: Schedule is map of schedule uuid to scheduleInfo

CredentialUUID.description: CredentialUUID is the cloud credential used with this schedule

MaxBackups.description:
MaxBackups are the maximum number of backups retained
in cloud.Older backups are deleted

Schedule.description: Schedule is the frequence of backup

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID is the schedule's source volume

RequestedState.description:
RequestedState is desired state of the op
can be pause/resume/stop

SrcVolumeID.description:
SrcVolumeID is volume ID on which backup/restore
state change is being requested

ID.description: ID is the ID for the operation

NodeID.description: NodeID is the ID of the node where this Op is active

OpType.description: OpType indicates if this is a backup or restore

Status.description: State indicates if the op is currently active/done/failed

Local.description:
Local indicates if only those backups/restores that are
active on current node must be returned

SrcVolumeID.description: SrcVolumeID optional volumeID to list status of backup/restore

Statuses.description: statuses is list of currently active/failed/done backup/restores

Cluster.title: Cluster represents the state of the cluster.

NodeId.description: Id of the node on which this cluster object is initialized

Nodes.description: array of all the nodes in the cluster.

ClusterConfig.description: ClusterConfig is a cluster level config parameter struct

ClusterResponse.description: ClusterResponse specifies a response that gets returned when requesting the cluster

CredCreateRequest.description: CredCreateRequest is the input for CredCreate command

InputParams.description: InputParams is map describing cloud provide

CredCreateResponse.description: CredCreateResponse is returned for CredCreate command

UUID.description: UUID of the credential that was just created

DefaultSecretKeyRequest.description: DefaultSecretKeyRequest specify request to set cluster secret key

FluentDConfig.title: FluentDConfig describes ip and port of a fluentdhost.

GetSecretResponse.description: GetSecretResponse gets secret value for given key

GraphDriverChanges.description:
GraphDriverChanges represent a list of changes between the filesystem layers
specified by the ID and Parent.  // Parent may be an empty string, in which
case there is no parent.
Where the Path is the filesystem path within the layered filesystem

Group.description:
Group represents VolumeGroup / namespace
All volumes in the same group share this object.

id.description: Id common identifier across volumes that have the same group.

GroupSnapCreateRequest.title: GroupSnapCreateRequest specifies a request to create a snapshot of given group.

GroupSnapCreateResponse.title: GroupSnapCreateRequest specifies a response that get's returned when creating a group snapshot.

KvdbConfig.description: KvdbConfig stores parameters defining kvdb configuration

NetworkConfig.description: NetworkConfig is a network configuration parameters struct

Node.description:
It includes the current physical state (CPU, memory, storage, network usage) as
well as the containers running on the system.
Node.title: Node describes the state of a node.

Disks.description: List of disks on this node.

NodeData.description: Node data for this node (EX: Public IP, Provider, City..)

NodeLabels.description: User defined labels for node. Key Value pairs

Pools.description: List of storage pools this node supports

NodeConfig.description: NodeConfig is a node level config data

NodesConfig.description: NodesConfig contains all of node level data

ReplicaSet.description:
ReplicaSet set of machine IDs (nodes) to which part of this volume is erasure
coded - for clustered storage arrays

RuntimeStateMap.description:
RuntimeStateMap is a list of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

SecretLoginRequest.description:
SecretLoginRequest specify secret store and config to initiate
secret store session

SecretsConfig.description: SecretsConfig is a secrets configuration parameters struct

SetSecretRequest.description: SetSecretRequest stores the given value/data against the key

SnapCreateRequest.title: SnapCreateRequest specifies a request to create a snapshot of given volume.

SnapCreateResponse.title: SnapCreateRequest specifies a response that get's returned when creating a snapshot.

Source.description:
Source is a structure that can be given to a volume
to seed the volume with data.

parent.description: A volume id, if specified will create a clone of the parent.

seed.description:
Seed will seed the volume from the specified URI
Any additional config for the source comes from the labels in the spec

StatPoint.description:
StatPoint represents the basic structure of a single Stat reported
TODO: This is the first step to introduce stats in openstorage.
Follow up task is to introduce an API for logging stats

Fields.description: Fields and values of the stat

Stats.description: Stats is a structure that represents last collected stats for a volume

interval_ms.description: Interval in ms during which stats were collected

read_ms.description: Time spent in reads in ms

write_ms.description: Time spent in writes in ms

StorageConfig.description: StorageConfig is a storage configuration parameters struct

StoragePool.description: StoragePool groups different storage devices based on their CosType

labels.description: Labels is a list of user defined name-value pairs

StorageResource.title: StorageResource groups properties of a storage device.

online.description: True if this device is online.

path.description: Path device path for this storage resource.

rotation_speed.description: True if this device is rotational.

Timestamp.title:
A Timestamp represents a point in time independent of any time zone
or calendar, represented as seconds and fractions of seconds at
nanosecond resolution in UTC Epoch time. It is encoded using the
Proleptic Gregorian Calendar which extends the Gregorian calendar
backwards to year one. It is encoded assuming all minutes are 60
seconds long, i.e. leap seconds are "smeared" so that no leap second
table is needed for interpretation. Range is from
0001-01-01T00:00:00Z to 9999-12-31T23:59:59.999999999Z.
By restricting to that range, we ensure that we can convert to
and from  RFC 3339 date strings.
See [https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt](https://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3339.txt).

nanos.description:
Non-negative fractions of a second at nanosecond resolution. Negative
second values with fractions must still have non-negative nanos values
that count forward in time. Must be from 0 to 999,999,999
inclusive.

seconds.description:
Represents seconds of UTC time since Unix epoch
1970-01-01T00:00:00Z. Must be from 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z to
9999-12-31T23:59:59Z inclusive.

TunnelConfig.description:
TunnelConfig describes key, cert and endpoint of a reverse proxy tunnel
DEPRECATED

VaultConfig.description: VaultConfig is a vault configuration parameters struct

Volume.description: Volume represents an abstract storage volume.
Volume.title: Volume represents an abstract storage volume.

attach_info.description: AttachInfo is a list of name value mappings that provides attach information.

attach_path.description: AttachPath is the mounted path in the host namespace.

attached_on.description: AttachedOn is the node instance identifier for clustered systems.

device_path.description: DevicePath is the device exported by block device implementations.

error.description: Error is the Last recorded error.

readonly.description: Readonly is true if this volume is to be mounted with readonly access.

replica_sets.description: ReplicatSets storage for this volumefor clustered storage arrays.

runtime_state.description:
RuntimeState is a lst of name value mapping of driver specific runtime
information.

secure_device_path.description: SecureDevicePath is the device path for an encrypted volume.

usage.description: Usage is bytes consumed by vtheis volume.

volume_consumers.description: VolumeConsumers are entities that consume this volume

VolumeConsumer.description:
VolumeConsumer identifies a consumer for a Volume. An example of a VolumeConsumer
would be a Pod in Kubernetes who has mounted the PersistentVolumeClaim for the
Volume
swagger: model

name.description: Name is the name of the volume consumer

namespace.description: Namespace is the namespace of the volume consumer

node_id.description:
NodeID is the identifier of the node on which the consumer is running. This
identifier would be from the perspective of the container runtime or
orchestrator under which the volume consumer resides. For example, NodeID
can be name of a minion in Kubernetes.

owner_name.description: OwnerName is the name of the entity who owns this volume consumer

owner_type.description:
OwnerType is the type of the entity who owns this volume consumer. The type would
be from the perspective of the container runtime or the orchestrator under which
the volume consumer resides. For e.g OwnerType can be a Deployment in Kubernetes.

type.description: Type is the type of the consumer. E.g a Kubernetes pod

VolumeCreateRequest.description:
VolumeCreateRequest is a structure that has the locator, source and spec
to create a volume

id.description:
ID of the newly created volume

in: body

VolumeLocator.description:
VolumeLocator is a structure that is attached to a volume
and is used to carry opaque metadata.

volume_labels.description: A set of name-value pairs that acts as search filters

VolumeResponse.title: VolumeResponse is a structure that wraps an error.

VolumeSetRequest.title: VolumeSet specifies a request to update a volume.

options.description:
additional options
required for the Set operation.

VolumeSpec.title: VolumeSpec has the properties needed to create a volume.

aggregation_level.description: Aggregatiokn level Specifies the number of parts the volume can be aggregated from.

cascaded.description: Cascaded is true if this volume can be populated on any node from an external source.

compressed.description: Compressed is true if this volume is to be compressed.

dedupe.description: Dedupe specifies if the volume data is to be de-duplicated.

encrypted.description: Encrypted is true if this volume will be cryptographically secured.

group_enforced.description: GroupEnforced is true if consistency group creation is enforced.

ha_level.description: HaLevel specifies the number of copies of data.

journal.description: Journal is true if data for the volume goes into the journal.

shared.description: Shared is true if this volume can be remotely accessed.

sharedv4.description: Sharedv4 is true if this volume can be accessed via sharedv4.

size.description: Size specifies the thin provisioned volume size.

snapshot_interval.description: SnapshotInterval in minutes, set to 0 to disable snapshots

snapshot_schedule.description: SnapshotSchedule a well known string that specifies when snapshots should be taken.

sticky.description: Sticky volumes cannot be deleted until the flag is removed.

VolumeState.title: VolumeState represents the state of a volume.

mount_path.description: MountPath Path where the device is mounted

VolumeStatus.title: VolumeStatus represents a health status for a volume.

clusterResponse.description: ClusterResponse specifies a response that gets returned when requesting the cluster

groupSnapCreateResponse.description: GroupSnapCreateRequest specifies a response that get's returned when creating a group snapshot.

snapCreateResponse.description: SnapCreateRequest specifies a response that get's returned when creating a snapshot.

volumeResponse.description: VolumeResponse is a structure that wraps an error.
